intro: Pseudognaphalium melanosphaerum, commonly known as the black globular everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features small, daisy-like flowers that are typically yellow or white, surrounded by green bracts. Its compact, globular shape and dark-colored seed heads give it a distinctive appearance. It is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
